title.value: Приемы повышения эффективности удобрений при возделывании картофеля на технические цели
Methods of increasing the efficiency of fertilizers in cultivation of potato to technical objectives

person.name: Khokh, V.A., National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). Grodno Regional Inst. of Plant Growing

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were presented research results on determination of the optimal fertilizer dose which could provide the maximal profitability of starch potato (Solanum tuberosum) varieties. Research results showed that the maximum profitability of Zdabytak and Vesnyanka potato varieties grown on sod-podzolic loamy sand soil was provided by application of mineral fertilizers in dose N80K40 (as a basic application) and N20P40K50 (into rows during planting) in combination with the foliar application at budding time with microfertilizer Ecolist standart (4 liters per hectare) against the background of manure 60 tons per hectare. This made it possible to obtain the increased yielding capacity with depending on the variety on 11,2-22,2%, starch content increased by 0.9-1.7% and the collection of starch per hectare increased by 1.6-2.4 tons.
